qas.question: What will the lower limbs of a tree usually do during development?
For what length of time can a dead lower limb stay attached to a tree?
Rather than being joined to the limb that died, where do subsequent layers grow?
Are the knots that dead tree limbs form attached or not attached?
A detached knot will probably drop out of the wood when someone saws it into what?

context: During the development of a tree, the lower limbs often <a0_0>die<a0_0/>, but may remain attached for a time, sometimes <a1_0>years<a1_0/>. Subsequent layers of growth of the attaching stem are no longer intimately joined with the dead limb, but are grown <a2_0>around it<a2_0/>. Hence, dead branches produce knots which are <a3_0>not attached<a3_0/>, and likely to drop out after the tree has been sawn into <a4_0>boards<a4_0/>.
